intro: Urostachys nitens, commonly known as the mountain saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Asia. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant has fleshy, often hairy leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. It thrives in rocky or alpine soils and is adapted to cold climates. Urostachys nitens is often found in mountainous areas of China, Nepal, and the Himalayas.
